intro: Descurainia tanacetifolia, commonly known as golden mustang grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and feathery leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an important plant for ecological studies and potential agricultural applications.
